# FLOPS

## Operands and Operations

1 + 1 = ?

## Operands and Operations

1 + 1 = 2

## Operands and Operations

1 + 1 = 2

The 1s are the operands and + is the operation

This calculation is one operation

## Floating Point

1.0 + 1.0 = ?

## Floating Point

1.0 + 1.0 = 2.0

## Floating point ops

1.0 + 1.0 = 2.0

This calculation is one Floating Point operation

If you can do it in one second you can compute at a rate of 1 FLOP/s

## Floating Point

0.1 + 0.2 = ?

## Floating Point

0.1 + 0.2 = 0.30000000000000004

Computer maths != people maths

(And yes it depends on the language / interpreter / precision)

|:----------|---------:|

| iPhone 13 |    19 GF |

| Dawn      | 19.46 PF |
| Frontier  | 1.194 EF |

## Supercomputing Applications

- Traditional

  - Simulating chemical reactions
  - Simulating nuclear reactions
  - CFD - Computational Fluid Dynamics

- Also

  - Materials science
  - Genomics
  - Astrophysics
  - Biomechanics (whole organ modelling)

- Basically anything where the performance of a single computer is a bottleneck
